subject: Re: Unit testing of jsp page
msgSnippet: ... When you say all java code I assume you mean only the Java code to invoke the bean, right? You don t have the bean coded in the JSP hopefully... So, why
messageBody:
shrikant wrote:
> Hi,
> I want information regarding testing of jsp pages. The jsp page
> contains two text fields. In that page only i am calling bean method
> which makes a SELECT query to the DB. I am populating those two text
> fields by the result of this select query.
> All java code are embedded as a scriplet.
> So how can i go about testing jsp pages?
> Pls help me. Do any one know some good sites which explains in details
> how to test jsp pages?
> Thanks well in advance.

When you say 'all java code' I assume you mean only the Java code to
invoke the bean, right? You don't have the bean coded in the JSP
hopefully... So, why not test the bean directly, using junit?

If you really have non-trivial amounts of Java code in the JSP, consider
refactoring to seperate presentation from application logic. If that's
not an option and you really need to write tests against the JSP itself,
look into Cactus.

L.
